Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Dwight enters dressed as Recyclops] Not again.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bow down before Recyclops.

Quote.Text: Five years ago, corporate said we had to start a recycling program for Earth Day so Dwight took the lead on that and introduced us to a very close friend of his named Recyclops.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Happy Earth Day, everyone. I'm Recyclops. Did you know that an old milk carton can be sawed in half and used as a planter?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The next year he really stepped things up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who has put a number seven plastic in a number four bin?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A year after that Recylcops really began to take shape.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Recylops will drown you in your over-watered lawns.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Then tragedy struck Recyclops when his fictional planet was attacked by some other fictitious thing... I can't remember.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Recyclops will have his revenge.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think this was also the year he renounced Earth Day and vowed to the destroy the planet he once loved.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, you guys, look. It's Recyclops.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Recyclops destroys! [starts tearing through the office]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, is today Recyclops Day?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I thought you were killed by Polluticorn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Polluticorn wishes. [starts spraying the office with something]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's aerosol spray. It's terrible for the environment.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Humans are terrible for the environment.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The thing I like most about Recyclops is that he's creating a different world for our child.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A world where you truly can be anything you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: God bless you, Recyclops. And your cold robot heart. [Dwight throws an aluminum can towards the recycling bin and misses]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [seated] Ok. Ok. How 'bout this? [rises, waves, sits back down]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want it to be better than 'Great', Pam. How 'bout I remain seated... and I just do a little bit of a nod. Sort of a humble thing. [demonstrates]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. Then my face is down. They can't see my face.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: And it looks like you're taking a dump.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alan Brand is the CEO of the company, if title's important to you, has personally invited moi to go to New York to the shareholder's meeting and sit up on the stage with the board of directors. And at some point they are going to introduce me as the most successful branch manager that they have. And then Michael Scott turns and waves to the crowd... and the crowd goes wild.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [doing an announcer voice] Ladies and gentlemen from Scranton, Pennsylvania, please welcome Michael 'The Machine' Scott. [Michael waves, twirls and sits down]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't do the twirl.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Lose the twirl.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The twirl sucks.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, I hated the twirl.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [still doing the voice & spinning in his chair] Hate the twirl!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Obviously I'm not going to do the twirl. I only did it because I nailed the wave.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, good. Don't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not going to do the twirl. Alright? It's not even a twirl, it's a spin. I might do the spin.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The long term problem is bad investments that they need to dump. The short term problem is the company has no cash and there's no where to get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, Oscar, I don't need the whole enchilada just the bullet points.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Those are the bullet points.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, could you condense it please?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's as simple as I can make it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael? The limo's here for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not a limo. It's a town car. Town cars are actually better, though. Better torque. Better handling.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He said limousine, so...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [at window in conference room] Check it out, guys. There's a limo down here. [everyone heads to the conference room] Michael, look. Oh, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They sent a limo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Town cars suck. Town car is something that a company sends when they're in trouble. A limousine is something that a company sends when they have cause for celebration. And in this case I think we are celebrating me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [everyone is rushing down the stairs to see the limo] Oh, wait. Wait. Wow. Wow! Oh, no way. Look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What kind of mileage does this baby get?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's like what high school kids take to prom on tv shows.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is so typical of management to spend money on this. Ugh. Bunch of boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hate to break it to you Oscar but some of us like boobs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Calves. Calves all the way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm so jealous right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you know who you should be jealous of? Yourself. Because you're invited and you're invited and you're invited and you and you and you and you and you and you-

Quote.Speaker: Limo Driver
Quote.Text: Car seats eight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Limo Driver
Quote.Text: The car seats eight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The limo seats eight. Ok. Then Jim and Pam and Ryan plus a guest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim & Pam
Quote.Text: No thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'll use it when you're done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [others start raising their hands to be picked] Mmm... whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The Dunder Mifflin stock symbol is DMI. Do you know what that stands for? Dummies, morons and idiots. Because that's what you'd have to be to own it. And, as one of those idiots, I believe the board owes me answers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the limo with Dwight, Andy and Oscar] I wish the windows weren't tinted so people could see us in here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, guys, do you think anyone might have had sex in here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smells like it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Definitely. Look they got pillows. That. That's bigger than my bed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Word.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [the limo driver raises the divider window] Who's playing with the button?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Ryan. Could you start consolidating all our Rolodex information into Outlook?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, it doesn't seem like there's much of a point if the company's going under.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But if the company doesn't go under then we'll finally have all our contacts in one program.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: The company's probably going under, though.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Could go either way.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Seems like it's leaning one way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe we should just wait and find out.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So should we wait to find out before we start doing all this stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nah. Might as well do it now.

Quote.Text: Michael, what if somebody asks you a question at this meeting? Are you just gonna wave, or what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will have to answer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll ask you a question.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Make it a softball. Something he can, like, crank out of the park.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael Scott you run the most profitable branch of Dunder Mifflin. How do you do it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. That's too hard. Say your name is Zamboni and then I will say, 'Well, we're sort of on thin ice.' [they all laugh] I won't say that. I'll something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is your big day. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my god. This is it.

Quote.Speaker: Laurie
Quote.Text: Mr. Scott?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Laurie
Quote.Text: I'm Laurie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hi.

Quote.Speaker: Laurie
Quote.Text: Thank you for joining us. Come with me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, thank you and, and please call - continue to call me Mr. Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Laurie
Quote.Text: Ok. If you just want to follow me I'll take you up to the lounge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I guess this is as far as I can take you guys. So -

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good luck, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking past bodyguards at the door] Officers. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Laurie
Quote.Text: After you, Mr. Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: So glad you could make it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: How was the ride?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. It was awesome. Very, very sublime.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I'm glad. I want to introduce you to everyone. First we'll start with Alan Brand. Alan? CEO. Michael Scott, Branch manager, Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: It's nice to meet you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's nice to meet you, too. It's an honor and a privilege.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Seated, we have the former congressman, Chris O'Keefe.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah. [bows] Your eminence.

Quote.Speaker: Registrar
Quote.Text: For those of you with questions, please line up behind one of the four microphones that have been placed in the aisles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Coming through. Che, che, che, che, che, che. [spots microphone and gets in line, sees an empty mic and attempts to get there first] Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me. [a line appears from nowhere] Ah. Damn it. [ heads back to the original line which is now even longer] Wha- okay [grunts]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was hoping to lob Michael his softball question early. I wanted to swing by the garment district, pick up a few crates of my shirts. I got a shirt guy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can you believe this? The money they spent on this convention hall. [finding a seat] Excuse me, miss. I just want to take the stupid board of directors by their necks. This is so simple.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Well, you should do that. Get in line.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, what a great idea and lose my job. No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Look, do you want to be able to tell your grandkids you stood up for yourself during the - America's biggest financial crisis?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How is he gonna have grandkids?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys ever protect the president?

Quote.Speaker: Security
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about Madonna? Or Obama twins? Anybody famous?

Quote.Speaker: Security
Quote.Text: Not supposed to talk about it. Nelly Furtado.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Alright, guys. You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rock and roll. [they walk into convention room and are booed by everyone]

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin is still a strong company. We are poised to come through this more streamlined and profitable than ever. [boos from the crowd]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to David] This is not as much fun as I thought it would be.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: It was fun when we weren't on the brink of bankruptcy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [accidentally into his microphone] We're going bankrupt, you think? [angry jeering from the crowd] They are really angry.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: The shareholders need to empower our leadership -

Quote.Speaker: Woman in line
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna run to the bathroom. Will you save my place?

Quote.Speaker: Man in line
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. You will not.

Quote.Speaker: Woman in line
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Were you raised in a household with no consequences?

Quote.Speaker: Woman in line
Quote.Text: It'll just be a second.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. If onlys and justs were candies and nuts then every day would be Erntedankfest.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: ... and we're confident. There are many things to be optimistic about in Dunder Mifflin's future and one of them is here with us today. Michael Scott, Scranton Branch manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [loudly applauds] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: In these uncertain times, Michael has managed to maintain steady profits from his Scranton branch. We all thank you, Michael. [scattered applause] Another bright spot in the Dunder Mifflin landscape, our new waste pulp re-purposing plant in Milford. [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Phyllis. Are you just getting back from lunch now?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Bob took me to Capello's. We got a little tipsy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. You shouldn't be telling me that stuff and also shouldn't be taking two hour lunches without telling me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, it's ok. Michael doesn't really care about these things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I care about them and I'm just as much of a boss as Michael. [Stanley laughs] What's so funny? I'm a co-manager.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That doesn't make you a boss.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's not like you can fire people or anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well - who? How did you? Who, who told you this?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Can't say.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sorry. Plastered.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. Who else has heard the rumor that I am not as much in charge as Michael? [everyone raises there hands - including Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stuff gets around. I don't participate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who here heard it from Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Does an email count?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. [everyone raises hands again]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am just as much of a boss as Michael and I can do anything that Michael can do. Alright? Who here believes that I have as much power as Michael? [Pam, after a moment, is the only one who raises her hand]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I forgot I have to support him no matter what. Close one.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: These questions are bush league.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You should get up and say something. You've got to be true to what's in there. [points to Oscar's heart] Don't be a wuss.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've always been the guy who can rally other people to rebel. In high school I organized a walk out over standardized testing. Got over 500 students to just skip the SATs. At the last second I chickened out, took it anyway, got a 1220, always regretted it. I feel lachrymose .

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [over the crowd booing] Believe me everyone is working very hard, working weekends, struggling, trying to right the ship.

Quote.Speaker: Shareholder
Quote.Text: You're a criminal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. I'm sorry. These are not criminals. They are nice. They invited me to come here today. They invited me to their hospitality suite where I had free food and it was delicious. Get this. Know how nice they are? The sent a stretch limo all the way to pick me up in Scranton. That's -

Quote.Speaker: Female Shareholder
Quote.Text: Limousine?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Second Shareholder
Quote.Text: You're all corrupt. You should be in jail. [crowd agrees]

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Quiet! Quiet, please! Please, quiet! Quiet, please. We want to hear your questions.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you love her or do you love the idea of her?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't know, man. I just don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I gotta make an example out of him. Should I just fire him?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you actually fire people?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To be honest, I don't know, but maybe I could just yell at him in front of people.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I can't really imagine you yelling at anyone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, well I yell. You've heard me yell.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Ok. I've heard you exclaim. Like the time you said, 'Hey, look. We parked over here!'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that was apple-picking day and there's no need to yell that day, you know. I was just excited to find the car. Perfect end to a perfect day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you'll figure it out.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Ok. We're gonna take a 15 minute break and then we're gonna answer more questions.

Quote.Speaker: Third Shareholder
Quote.Text: You haven't said anything yet and we're headed for bankruptcy. [crowd agrees]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [board of directors has started to exit] Yeah, well, that's not gonna happen. That's not gonna happen. We'll be back with some answers. [a few murmurs from the crowd of 'What answers?'] I - ok. I know that you're mad at me and you're mad at all them -

Quote.Speaker: Fourth Shareholder
Quote.Text: How are you gonna fix the company?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Alright. We are gonna - we're gonna go out there during this break and we are gonna come back with a plan. We're gonna come back with a plan for you. It's a 45 day plan. 45 days to get us back on track. [crowd starts to agree and perk up] 45 points. It's a 45 day/45 point. One point per day. We get the 45 points we are back in business. [crowd applauds] And you can take that to the bank. [applause continue] And Limo Lady, we are going completely carbon neutral. [crowd has gotten very excited and is cheering] I love you, New York! [Michael does the spin and leaves the stage - then runs back across the stage] You. You.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Ryan. How's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [playing Tetris on his computer] Here's the thing. Um, I've tried it like five different ways in my head and - Oh, got one. Um, I'm such a perfectionist...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That I'd kinda rather not do it all then do a crappy version.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Simple data entry, though. So there's really only one way to do it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Sounds like you have a really specific vision for it. Do you wanna maybe just take a whack at it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I know the problem.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you seem distracted.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yep, that is a problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But, you know what? I came up with something and I think it's really gonna help.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Well, I'm glad you're finally being proactive, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am, too. Let me show you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Things are really picking up.

Quote.Speaker: O'Keefe
Quote.Text: What was that about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: You were supposed to wave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did wave. I did a lot more than wave.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: What are we supposed to tell them now? Ok? You've dug us quite a hole.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We tell them the plan, right?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: There is no plan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here's what we're gonna do. The 45 day thing that I outlined, we go with that. Day 45, company saved. Day 44, go. What do we got? We have 15 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: O'Keefe
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just whatever comes to mind. Shout it out.

Quote.Speaker: O'Keefe
Quote.Text: Who the hell is this guy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am the guy who roused that crowd.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got them on their feet.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They were so happy down there.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Who cares?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Alright. Well, I know a guy. This Mexican guy. He is a math whiz. He knows economics as well as he knows bull fighting and I am going to call in a little favor.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No. No. No. No. No. No. Don't call anybody, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I'm texting him, so.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Please do not text anybody, now, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's done. [Oscar, sitting in the lobby, receives a text]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. There he is. Come on in. Come on in. Gentleman, I would like you to meet Oscar. Come on in. Don't be shy. This is Oscar Martinez. Oscar, why don't you come over here. Let me present you. Step up. Step up there. Oscar is an accountant extraordinaire at the Scranton branch and he has a wonderful idea as to how to get us out of this murky, murky situation. Take it away. [Oscar stands there stunned]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think this is really gonna help. If you could just hold up here one second. [addresses the whole office] Hey, guys. Quick announcement. If I could just have everyone's attention. [turns back to Ryan] I just figured you needed a place where you can concentrate and not be bothered by bothering people.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let me show you what I mean. [Jim opens the closet door to reveal a work station] Your new office. How great is that, right? For a job well done. Well, not done.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I will, uh, I will do my work right now. I will stay late tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, I'm very sorry... about everything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [laughs] You're a good kid. You know what? It gets bigger once you're in there. Enjoy it. [shuts the door and walks to his office]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [from behind the door] Is there internet?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ummm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell them what you told me. This is genius.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ok

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell them about the cash flow and the dumping of properties and - this is all -

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Um..

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's all good. It's all good stuff. Lay it on them.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I feel, as does Mr. Scott, that we are in the best of hands. Capable hands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That wasn't what you were saying to me. He was much more articulate and that was better. Much better.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think this has gone very well and I thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: O-kay. Oh... hey, hey. [follows Oscar into the hall] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, I didn't ask to come up here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, man. That -

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was embarrassing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: For me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For me, too. You embarrassed me.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You -[Oscar walks away, Michael goes back in the room]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that was a waste of a text. Let's get down to brass tacks. I think that we might be in trouble. We don't seem to have a plan so I'm thinking I go down there. Maybe rattle off a few jokes. Congressman could follow.

Quote.Speaker: O'Keefe
Quote.Text: He's our best manager? Where's the off button on this moron?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I'm not a moron. Time after time my branch leads in sales. I have personally won over 17 Dundie awards. So, I am not a moron and I am just trying to help, you know? So... you're the moron.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [zipping through the hall while texting]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is a thrill to be honored by one's company. To have the people that you work for stop for a minute and say, 'Wow. Great job.' That is what it is all about. Not the perks. Perks? The perks. I could take or leave the perks. Limos are for people who make the company money not lose millions and have no plan. So we're leaving early. After all, we are the only ones with anything to celebrate.

Quote.Speaker: O'Keefe
Quote.Text: He can take the bus. He's had his limo ride.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [running out of the building with Oscar, Andy, and Dwight] Oscar! Oscar! Come on! There he is! There he is! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Scranton! Scranton! Scranton! Dunder Mifflin!

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: The gentleman in the, uh, glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute, Scranton branch. I just want to say that I have been standing in this line all day and if this line is any indication of how this company is being run then we are in big trouble. [cheers from crowd] Thank you. Right. I know. And I just want to say that I believe that there are options out there. [crowd still applauding] A take a number option like they have in a deli. What about line varieties? Like an express line for quick comments of ten words or less. They can move much more efficiently. What about ropes along the lines that you can hold on to.

Quote.Speaker: Alan
Quote.Text: Thank you. Thank you for your suggestions.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.
